info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Robeson County through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rowland, or 10 miles northeast of Dillon, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Red Springs, Pembroke, St. Pauls, Rowland, Rex, Shannon, Buie, Robeson Community College, Wakulla, Barker Ten Mile, Purvis, Prospect, Elrod, Parkton, Rennert, Mcdonald, Lumber Bridge and Raynham. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
